hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Add positioning recommendation versioning and channel pinning to reduce messaging drift.docx

sections.text:
This feature reduces “messaging drift” by introducing lightweight versioning for positioning recommendations and making that version explicit everywhere copy is authored and reviewed. Today, teams can update channel assets (e.g., web, email, paid) while implicitly relying on whatever the “current” recommendation is, which makes it easy to unintentionally mix old and new guidance across channels.

We will add a simple recommendation version model keyed by segment, effective date, and author/approver, so there is a clear, auditable baseline of what was approved and when. This makes positioning changes intentional and traceable, enabling teams to evolve messaging without losing historical context or creating ambiguity about which guidance was used.

Each messaging channel asset will be able to “pin” to an approved recommendation version, storing the pinned version ID directly on the asset. This turns the baseline from an assumption into a concrete reference per channel, allowing teams to update one channel at a time while still remaining consistent with the intended recommendation for that asset.

Finally, we’ll expose the pinned version ID via the internal API so the existing messaging consistency audit can compare copy against the correct baseline for that asset, rather than a potentially newer recommendation. The expected impact is fewer cross-channel inconsistencies, less rework during reviews, and higher confidence that approved positioning is applied correctly as recommendations evolve.
